articles.headline: Shippers Concerned Over Possible Suez Canal Disruptions
articles.snippet: Egypt is not a major oil exporter, but it is a crucial link for petroleum products headed from the Middle East to Europe and the United States.
articles.abstract: Egypt is not a major oil exporter, but it is a crucial link for petroleum products headed from the Middle East to Europe and the United States.
articles.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — As violence has broken out in Egypt, concern has turned to the risk of the blocking of the Suez Canal or nearby pipelines, which could pose a threat to world energy supplies.

articles.headline: S.E.C. Hurt by Disarray in Its Books
articles.snippet: The agency responsible for guaranteeing the soundness of financial markets argues that it needs more money, but falls short in basic accounting.
articles.abstract: The agency responsible for guaranteeing the soundness of financial markets argues that it needs more money, but falls short in basic accounting.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  If a company’s financial reporting were so bad that its auditor had pointed out significant weaknesses in its accounting for seven years running, the Securities and Exchange Commission would most likely be all over it.

articles.headline: Street Battle Over the Arab Future
articles.snippet: Whether protest or crackdown prevails in Egypt, a region trapped in stagnation seems permanently altered.
articles.abstract: Whether protest or crackdown prevails in Egypt, a region trapped in stagnation seems permanently altered.
articles.lead_paragraph: CAIRO  The future of the Arab world, perched between revolt and the contempt of a crumbling order, was fought for in the streets of downtown Cairo on Wednesday.

articles.headline: Foreclosed Homeowners Go to Court on Their Own
articles.snippet: With legal aid groups overwhelmed, courts are seeing a sharp rise in defendants representing themselves.
articles.abstract: With legal aid groups overwhelmed, courts are seeing a sharp rise in defendants representing themselves.
articles.lead_paragraph: ALBUQUERQUE  Saving your home from foreclosure is increasingly a do-it-yourself project.

articles.headline: Energy Firms Aided by U.S. Find Backers
articles.snippet: The firms were six out of a group of 37 that had received federal assistance because they were deemed too radical or too preliminary to attract private money.
articles.abstract: The firms were six out of a group of 37 that had received federal assistance because they were deemed too radical or too preliminary to attract private money.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  In late 2009, the federal government gave $151 million in grants to advance 37 clean energy ideas deemed too radical or too preliminary to attract much private financing  like electricity storage that mimics photosynthesis and batteries that double or triple the energy stored per pound.

articles.headline: Sudden Split Recasts U.S. Foreign Policy
articles.snippet: As the United States openly broke with Egypt, the regional calculus was swiftly and dramatically altered.
articles.abstract: As the United States openly broke with Egypt, the regional calculus was swiftly and dramatically altered.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — After days of delicate public and private diplomacy, the United States openly broke with its most stalwart ally in the Arab world on Wednesday, as the Obama administration strongly condemned violence by allies of President Hosni Mubarak of Egypt against protesters and called on him to speed up his exit from power.
articles.byline: By Helene Cooper, Mark Landler and Mark Mazzetti

articles.headline: News Corporation Introduces The Daily, a Digital-Only Newspaper
articles.snippet: For the company, the iPad app represents an opportunity to try to reinvent the business model for news publishing.
articles.abstract: For the company, the iPad app represents an opportunity to try to reinvent the business model for news publishing.
articles.lead_paragraph: Rupert Murdoch on Wednesday pushed the send button on The Daily, a news application designed for the iPad that he hopes will position his News Corporation front and center in the digital newsstand of the future.
articles.byline: By Jeremy W. Peters and Brian Stelter

articles.headline: For iPhone, Almost Heaven
articles.snippet: The Verizon iPhone will become available on Feb. 10. Does AT&T have anything to worry about?
articles.abstract: The Verizon iPhone will become available on Feb. 10. Does AT&T have anything to worry about?
articles.lead_paragraph: It’s here. After almost four years of speculation, the iPhone will finally come to Verizon’s network on Feb. 10.

articles.headline: Crackdown in Egypt Widens but Officials Offer Concessions
articles.snippet: While blaming foreigners for the unrest, the Egyptian government offered concessions that once would have been startling.
articles.abstract: While blaming foreigners for the unrest, the Egyptian government offered concessions that once would have been startling.
articles.lead_paragraph: CAIRO  The Egyptian government on Thursday broadened its crackdown on a 10-day uprising that has shaken its rule, arresting journalists and human rights advocates across an edgy city, while offering more concessions in a bid to win support from a population growing frustrated with a devastated economy and scenes of chaos in the streets.
